meanings.sent1: She walked damply through the foggy forest.
meanings.sent2: The clothes hung damply on the line after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The dog shook itself damply after jumping in the lake.
meanings.sent4: The old book smelled damply of mildew and age.
meanings.sent5: The air felt damply against her skin, making her shiver.

meanings.sent1: The ground was damply from the morning dew.
meanings.sent2: Her hair felt damply after being caught in the drizzle.
meanings.sent3: The cake turned out damply because of too much frosting.
meanings.sent4: The flowers wilted in the damply soil of the garden.
meanings.sent5: His socks were always damply after playing in the puddles.
